page.title: 12THE GOLDEN BALL P.H.
page.content: The Golden Ball has been a Public House for over 500 years. It is owned by the Wethered Brewery. The licence is held by the Whitbread family. Inside The Golden Ball there are lots of low beams. Several alterations have been made in the pub and there is now a restaurant in one bar. Outside there is a garden for adults to sit in and a play area for children, with swings and a man-made tree which has a big face painted on it. The Golden Ball opens at lunchtimes, and in the evenings. Sometimes special entertainments like an Italian evening and barbques, are arranged. About 150 people visit The Golden Ball each day. The most popular drink is lager, beer costs 80p for a pint, and a gin & tonic costs 97p. In the restaurant you can have a good meal for about Â£3.50.
